product.title: OneAll Social Login
product.description: Social Login for vBulletin4 allows your users to login and register with their social network accounts. It increases your user registration rate by simplifying the registration and provides demograpic data retrieved from the social network profiles.

templates.template: Warning! Please enable at least one social network in the Social Login settings in your vBulletin admin area.

{vb:raw oasl_caption}

Warning! Please enable at least one social network in the Social Login settings in your vBulletin admin area.
• {vb:raw oasl_caption}
Warning! Please enable at least one social network in the Social Login settings in your vBulletin admin area.

{vb:raw oasl_caption}

Warning! Please enable at least one social network in the Social Login settings in your vBulletin admin area.

<vb:if condition="$oasl_subdomain != ''">
					<!-- OneAll.com / Social Login for vBulletin -->
					<script type="text/javascript">
					<!--
						var oal = document.createElement("script"); oal.type = "text/javascript"; oal.async = true;
						oal.src = "//{vb:raw oasl_subdomain}.api.oneall.com/socialize/library.js";
						var oas = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0]; oas.parentNode.insertBefore(oal, oas);
					// -->
					</script>
				</vb:if>

plugin.title: Social Login Integration

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: OneAll Social Login: Social Login Settings
OneAll Social Login: Social Link Settings
If enabled, users can login and register with their social network accounts.
This title is displayed near the Social Login icons in the upper navigation bar.
This title is displayed above the Social Login icons on the registration page.
If enabled, users can connect their social network accounts to their existing vBulletin account.
This title is displayed above the Social Link icons in the users' profile settings.
Automatically link social network accounts to existing user accounts?
If enabled, social network accounts with a verified email address will be linked to existing user accounts having the same email address.
Import avatars from the social networks?
If enabled, user avatars will be retrieved from the social network profiles and stored in your vBulletin folder.

Select the port to be used to connect to the OneAll API.
Your firewall must allow outbound requests on the selected port.
Select the connection handler to be used to communicate with the OneAll API.
Enter the Public Key of your OneAll site.
Enter the Private Key of your OneAll site.
Enter the Subdomain of your OneAll site - Click here to obtain your API Credentials

setting.defaultvalue: Login with your social network account
Link your social networks accounts to your user account.
